revised_title: High Resolution Molecular Photoelectron Spectroscopy: Fine Structure in Hydrogen and Oxygen Spectra
tldr: The authors developed a high-resolution molecular photoelectron spectrometer to study the fine structure in the spectra of hydrogen and oxygen. They achieved energy resolution of around 0.1 eV, which allowed them to resolve rotational fine structure in the spectra. The study focused on the ionized molecular species and their vibrational excitation, providing insights into the molecular structure and behavior of hydrogen and oxygen.
